text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['16. kavavatanen no kotat', 'kotat蟹的故事', 'The story about a crab', '', 'si Tonasen (M, 52, Yayo)', '賴金龍，男，52，椰油村', '']

S.FORM: nokákoa rana am, noka-paci-key-ke-yray ko pa noka-k-anak-an namen am,
S.TRANSL: 以前，我小時候常去同伴的家裡睡覺
I used to sleep at my friend’s house when I was young.

S.FORM: aro namen a ma-’eza-’eza a mi-ang-angay a maci-walam namen do ra-ra-rakeh a.
S.TRANSL: 我們很多年紀相仿的孩子們常去聽老人家聊天說故事
Many of us of the same age would go together and listen to the elders telling stories.

S.FORM: ma-níring sira am, “abo o kava-kavavatanen nokakoa ni-m-ami-amizing mo?”
S.TRANSL: 他們說，“你有沒有聽過的以前故事？”
They said, “Haven’t you heard any stories before?”

S.FORM: ji kamo mi-ziziak a amizing-en nio an” koan na, “nohon”,
S.TRANSL: 你們聽著不可以講話” 他說。“好”
You have to sit quietly and listen,” said he. “Okay,”

S.FORM: ka-to namen ngamizing-an sia aro a ka-k-anak-an a,
S.TRANSL: 我們一群小孩子就這樣靜靜的聽他說故事
The group of children would listen to his stories.

S.FORM: mi-zí-ziak am, asa ka tao o anak na, manga anak ko am,
S.TRANSL: 他說，“孩子們！有一戶人家，家裡只有一個孩子
He said, “there was a family that only had one child, my children.”

S.FORM: ji á-teneng-i ka mavakes na, ka mehakay na koan na,
S.TRANSL: 但（那個孩子）不知是女孩還是男孩
They didn’t know if it was a boy or girl.

S.FORM: ra-roa sira miaven-do-vahay a,
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個夫妻（指孩子的父母親）
(There was also) this couple.

S.FORM: akmi to naze-tazéstes o anak na am, to da ngay mi-aw-awat do vanoa,
S.TRANSL: 小孩漸漸長大了；有天他去海邊游泳
The child slowly grew up. One day he went swimming at the seashore.

S.FORM: mi-aw-awat do vanoa ori, mi-ratateng am, to mi-linga-língay so ma-ney-savat ori o k-anak-an ang,
S.TRANSL: 小孩子在海邊游泳時，隨意的張望著礁石群處正在捉螃蟹的人們
The child watched the people catching crabs while he was swimming.

S.FORM: to maka-cita do tey-rala so, am mang-ci do dang, to maka-cita so líkey a civet,
S.TRANSL: 當時海水正好退潮，忽然，他看見岸邊有一個小小的civet蟹
At the time the tide had just gone back, and suddenly he saw a small civet crab.

S.FORM: “o, civet” koan na, am ji na ni-ha-hap ori,
S.TRANSL: “喔，有civet蟹！” 他說，可是他並沒有把它捉起來
“Oh, a civet crab!” he said, but he didn’t catch it.

S.FORM: “a ma-závak ya ji ko nita-nita” koan na, “moa-moa ko” koan na no alíkey a k-anak-an ori a,
S.TRANSL: “太好了，以後我就常來看它” ，“我來養它（當寵物）” 小孩說
“Great! I will come see it all the time and raise it (as a pet),” the child said.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, to ngían do dang a,
S.TRANSL: 小孩子就一直待在那裡看
The child stayed there for a long time.

S.FORM: “am ikong kan-en na no nang” koan na no alíkey a k-anak-an ang,
S.TRANSL: “它吃什麼呢？” 小孩心想
“What will it eat?” the child thought.

S.FORM: one-oned na am, to mi-zí-ziak o one-oned na, “a ikong kan-en na no nang, a ji mák-asi ori, ji á-kcin ori” koan na.
S.TRANSL: 不過那只是小孩子心裡想的話而已。“它吃什麼呢？它會餓呢，會很可憐”
“I don’t know what it eats. It will be very piteous. It will be very hungray,” the kid thought and said.

S.FORM: ano ma-era-raw a m-in-apo do anga-ngay-an na am, mi mang-hap rana so m-avaw na, ka-ngay na nia so tey-sa vekeh am,
S.TRANSL: 每當中午從別處回來時，他就先回家拿一塊冷（剩）飯（地瓜/芋頭），然後就去海邊
Every noon after work, the child would bring a piece of cold [leftover food [sweet potato, taro form home to the seashore.

S.FORM: to na i pangáy-a am, a ni-ma-sita na o ka-kan na sia,
S.TRANSL: 他就把食物放在它旁邊，但是小孩子沒有看見它吃那個食物
He put the food next to it, but he did not see it eat.

S.FORM: ipi-doa na so ka-ngay na t-om-ita sia am, ni-akta-kta na no civet ori a ka-kan na sia,
S.TRANSL: 他再去看它時，發現civet已把食物弄碎且吃了一點
The second time he looked, the civet crab had shredded the food and was eating.

S.FORM: “o, ya k-om-an so so-soli ya” koan na am, to-dey mang-ap so ma-ma-vaw na am, mi na i-tey-toro a,
S.TRANSL: “喔，它也會吃芋頭！” 於是就常常拿冷飯（芋頭）來給它吃
“Oh, it will eat taro,” so he went to get more leftover (taro) for it.

S.FORM: ji ngimong-ímong do ar-araw am veha-vehan am aw-awan o ka-paka-pa-kan na sia.
S.TRANSL: 就這樣，從每天到每月甚至每年不曾間斷的給它東西吃
In this way, every day, every week, and for years, he never stopped taking food to the crab.

S.FORM: i-ké-yngen na no oo na ni ina na a ka no ama na am,
S.TRANSL: 他父母親因此對他感到非常的頭痛
His parents thought that he was a pain in the neck.

S.FORM: “a ya mi jin si ikoa ori a, a ya ji riag am, ya ji ngagza, ya ji ngoyab a”
S.TRANSL: “孩子到底是去哪裡？為什麼常常不吃早飯，不吃午後飯，連晚飯也都不吃呢？”
“Where does he go? Why does he often not eat breakfast, skip lunch, and even miss dinner?”

S.FORM: “ya toda ang-ángay do vanoa a ya mang-hap so ya tey-sa vekeh a”
S.TRANSL: “他怎麼總是拿一塊芋頭往海邊去”
“He always takes a taro to the seashore.”

S.FORM: “ikong na mi pa-riag-en ori am, ikong na pa-gza-en ori a, na po-wyab-en do awa ang,”
S.TRANSL: “他拿食物去海邊到底是給誰吃早飯，午飯和晚飯？”
“Who is he feeding breakfast, lunch, and dinner at the seashore?”

S.FORM: to mínda do ka-sa rangan na no likod no civet,
S.TRANSL: 小civet蟹漸漸的長大，其背已長約一個中、拇指撐開的長度了
The small civet crab slowly grew up, and the length of its back is about the distance between the middle finger and the thumb.

W.TRANSL: 中指與拇指撐開的長度

M.TRANSL: 中指與拇指撐開的長度

S.FORM: ratateng am, to mínda do kasi-ka-roa na rangan no likod na no civet ori koan da, aráko rana,
S.TRANSL: 後來聽說，civet蟹再長後，背長約有二十個拇中指撐開的長度，長得很大
The civet continued to grow, and the shell was already more than twenty times the length of the distance between the middle finger and the thumb, and that is pretty big.

W.TRANSL: 中指與拇指撐開的長度

M.TRANSL: 中指與拇指撐開的長度

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, o kavos-an na no ni-alikey na ka-kamay na am, akmi tanoro o ka-ka-kamay na no civet ori,
S.TRANSL: civet蟹連最小支的腳也有人的手指般粗大
Its smallest leg was as big around as a human finger.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, no ma-ngay ma-pangay so kan-en na o ka-nak-an ori am,
S.TRANSL: 每當那小孩子去給它送食物（擺在洞口旁邊）
Every time the child put the food (near the hole),

S.FORM: no ma-níring ori am, “pi-ci-cingi rana kota-kotat, ta i-panta ko imo so so-soli a kan-en mo” koan na no alíkey a k-anak-an ori a,
S.TRANSL: 他就說，“kotakotat蟹你出來吧，我帶了芋頭給你吃”
he said, “Kotakotat crab, come out, for I have some taro for you.”

S.FORM: ji pa mi-to-toaw, “pi-ci-cingi rana kota-kotat, ta i-panta ko imo so kan-en mo” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 它還不出來。他就再叫“kotakotat蟹你出來吧，我給你帶了食物來”
It wouldn’t come out. He said again, “Kotakotat, come out, for I have some food for you.”

S.FORM: ma-mízing na no ráko a civet am, to mi-agag am, to na a-cita rana o ai na mi-agag am,
S.TRANSL: 大civet蟹聽到了，就慢慢的爬出來；他也看見蟹腳伸出了洞口
When the big civet crab heard it, it slowly came out. He saw its legs slowly coming out of the hole.

S.FORM: aráko rana o ai-ai na,
S.TRANSL: 它的腳已長很大了
Its legs were already very big.

S.FORM: no ka-panci na no “pi-cingi-cingi rana kota-kotat, ta i-panta ko imo so adoa vekeh a so-soli” koan na no nang am,
S.TRANSL: 他只要說“kotakotat你出來吧，我帶了兩塊芋頭給你吃”
all he had to say was, “Kotakotat, come out, for I brought two taros for you.”

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, ji na pa a-mizing kono a,
S.TRANSL: 可是civet蟹沒有聽到
But we were told the crab didn’t hear.

S.FORM: “ala ori o mapi-moa-moa jiaken” koan na am, to mak-ówbot a.
S.TRANSL: kotat想“可能是我的主人吧” ，於是慢慢的爬出來
“It’s probably my master” kotat thought, and he slowly crawled out.

S.FORM: i-sáray no k-anak-an a, ji na ngaro-i, ta no pe-pnezak a pi-kates-en a pi-sibo-en no ra-rakeh no ma-ngay do takey am, ji na pa ngaro-i a,
S.TRANSL: 小孩子對kotat非常的喜歡，每次去看它就不捨得離去。每天早上，老人家上山的時間過了，他還是不捨得離去

The child was very happy to see kotat, and every time he would be reluctant to go. Even after the time that old people were ready to go to work in the fields in the morning, he would be unwilling to go.

S.FORM: no todaji mi-ígen o araw am, ori o karo-an na jia, ta akma na i ka-kteh saon am,
S.TRANSL: 一直到太陽爬到頂端的時候才離去，對他來說，kotat就像是他的同胞兄弟一樣
Not until almost noontime would he be willing to leave, just as if it were part of his own family.

S.FORM: ano mina ra-rakeh sio am, akma na i anak o akma sang a ni-azo-azovo na rako a civet ori a,
S.TRANSL: 如果把他（小孩）比作老人講，那麼他養的civet蟹就像是他的孩子一樣
If you think of the child as an old man, then he cared for the civet as if it were his child.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, ji ngimo-ngímong ori am, no mi na i-panci am, “pi-cingi-cingi rana kota-kotat, ta i-panta ko imo so kanen mo a adoa vekeh a so-soli”,
S.TRANSL: 小孩子從未間斷過的（探視它）。每一次他去看它時，總說“kotakotat你出來吧，我帶了兩塊芋頭給你吃”
The child didn’t stop (taking food). Every time he went, he would say, “Kotakotat, come out, for I have two taros for you”

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, ma-níring o civet am, “ci ci ci ci ci ”koan na,
S.TRANSL: civet（出洞的時候）會發出“吱吱吱” 的聲音
Civet would come out chattering.

S.FORM: am mi-ciri-ciring ori am, ka-teng-an na o ciri-ciring na a,
S.TRANSL: 螃蟹是在說話，只是小孩子聽不懂而已
The crab was speaking, but the child didn’t understand.

S.FORM: “ikong na i-panci ori a, ya akmi ji maka-bne-bnek ori, a ikong ori” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 小孩說“它在說什麼啊？像啞吧一樣，不知道講什麼？”
“What is it saying? It doesn’t seem to know how to speak human tongue (like a dumb), so what is it trying to say?” the child said.

S.FORM: ori o ni-ka-miying-an namen nia do ra-rakeh ori a ni-on-onong-an na, ta ikongo o ciri-ciring na o ka-pi-cicicit na,
S.TRANSL: 所以當我們聽到老人講到螃蟹會吱吱的說話時，我們就都會放聲大笑，不知道螃蟹吱吱的叫是什麼意思
At the time, when we heard the old men mention (the crab’s chattering), we would think it was funny, because we didn’t know what the crab’s chattering was about.

S.FORM: am koanata, ta no ma-níring sira sio o i-sey-savat a cive-civet am, “ci ci ci.”
S.TRANSL: 當然啦，我們也知道civet蟹確實會發出吱吱的聲音
Of course, we also know the civet crabs do make chattering sounds.

S.FORM: no mi-cicicit sira mi-zi-ziak sira sio am, ori o anoyong-an namen jia.
S.TRANSL: 螃蟹確實會吱吱叫的講話，所以我們也相信老人說的話
The chattering was a sign of talking, so we believed in the old man’s word.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, aráko rana ji rana maka-ngay do vahay na am,
S.TRANSL: 後來螃蟹長大到所住的洞穴也容不下它了以後
After a while the crab grew too big for its home.

S.FORM: am “mi ko pala a”, mi na i-panta do ariag-en da a so ariag-en na,
S.TRANSL: “我該去看看它了” ，於是他又從他們的早飯中拿了食物帶去給它吃
“I should go see it,” so he took food from his breakfast to the crab.

S.FORM: “pi-cingi-cingi rana kota-kotat, ta i-panta ko imo so kanen mo” koan na am, to mi-ágag a.
S.TRANSL: “kotakotat你快出來，我帶了食物給你吃” 他說。kotat蟹就爬出來
“Kotakotat, come out, for I have some food for you,” he said. Then the crab came out.

S.FORM: i-ké-yngen na no oo na ni ina na a ka no ama na am,
S.TRANSL: 他的父母親對他感到很頭痛
His parents thought that he was a big nuisance.

S.FORM: “a ikong rana na y-ang-angay ni alikey do awa ori do vanoa ori a? ikong na y-angay no nang” koan da am,
S.TRANSL: “孩子怎麼老往海邊跑？他去那裡做什麼呢？”
“Why does he always run to the seashore? What does he go there for?

S.FORM: i-sezez da am, “a ori o na angay-an” koan da, to da nezéz-an o anak da ori a,
S.TRANSL: 他們偷偷的跟探他，“哦，原來是去那裡啊” ，他們一直跟著，偷看他們的孩子
They watched him from the shadows, and said, “Oh, so that is where he goes,” and they continued to watch.

S.FORM: to mang-ónong a to mang-ónong a, to ’ók-’okso do zawa-zawang a ma-ngay do angay-an na am,
S.TRANSL: 小孩子一直走一直走，有時候會跳下水溝往前走去
The child kept on walking, and walking, and then jumped off the channel and kept on walking.

S.FORM: “a ya miji-mijin do zawa-zawang ori a, na ka-tana-tanang ori a, na k-angay do dang ori”,
S.TRANSL: “他怎麼一會兒下水溝，一會兒又上來，一會兒又往那裡去的？”
“Why is he going down the channel, going up, and then keeps on going?”

S.FORM: to neyked am, ji rana mi-to-toaw am, to rana ngian do dang, tovil-an da o payo-payok-an na,
S.TRANSL: 忽然他停下來就不再見到他的人影了，他一直待在那裡。他們環顧周邊找個標記，以便辨認他停下來的地方
He suddenly stopped and didn’t come out for a while. His parents were on his tail, and looked to see if there was anything they recognized.

S.FORM: “ning a, ya m-ian do dang ori a”, to mak-ówbot am, ni-ma-cita da o pak-owbot-an na, ka-to na a-kman-an sang a.
S.TRANSL: “哦，原來這裡就是他常來的地方！” 。忽然，他又起來了，他們也看見了孩子出來的地方；就這樣，他們才明白了怎麼一回事
“Oh, so this is the place.” They saw the child come out, and knew that he went there a lot.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, mi rana maci-’eza-’eza ori,
S.TRANSL: 他離去以後，就去找他的同伴們玩
After he left, he went to find his friends.

S.FORM: ji á-teneng-i o ka ni-ma-ngay na am, ma-no-nobwo ka ni-mi-kala-kala so oma-omaom no nang a, ka pa-meyret na no nang, a ka-teneng-an o ni-angay-an na no nang.
S.TRANSL: 不知道他是去採苦菜，還是去採山蘇花，或是去撿田螺。反正就是不知道他後來去了哪裡
I don’t know if he went to pick herbs, flowers, or pick up shells. They didn’t know where he went afterwards.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, “ikongo na y-ang-angay ni alikey do dang ori a,
S.TRANSL: “孩子常去那裡到底是做什麼？
“Why does the kid go there so often?

S.FORM: a mang-day noka-líkey na pa ni alikey am, tey-sa vekeh a tey-de-doa vekeh o na y-angay do dang am, ya na toda rakó-an a,
S.TRANSL: 打從他很小時候開始就每天拿一塊或兩塊芋頭去那裡，一直到現在他都已經長大了還去那裡
Ever since he was small he has been taking one or two taros there. Even though he is big now, he still goes there so often.

S.FORM: ya todaji maci-vaha-vahay am mapa-vaha-vahay am, ya pa manga-mangay do dang a, ikong na ma-ngay paka-pa-kan-en do dang” koan da,
S.TRANSL: 他都已經快到嫁/娶的年紀了還是常去那裡，他去那裡在餵養什麼？”
He is already close to the age of marriage and he’s still going there. What is he feeding there?”

S.FORM: a kois ta ya m-ian dang so kois a? manok ta ya m-ian do wawa so manok? to da ningí-an ori,
S.TRANSL: “不可能是豬吧？那裡怎麼會有豬。也不可能是雞？海上也不可能有雞？” 他們一直偷偷的孩子看
“Pigs? No, no pigs would live there. Chickens? Chickens don’t live in the sea.” They kept spying on that.

S.FORM: ma-níring o mehakay na am, “mi ta pala kala-en” koan na, ta abo rana o anak na ni-ma-ngay do takey ori a,
S.TRANSL: 她的先生說” 我們去找找看好了？” 因為他們的孩子不在家，去了山上
“Let’s go find out what it is,” the husband said. The child had left and gone into the mountains.

S.FORM: mi da kala-en am, to ngazat do ngoso na o rako a, akmi alikey a k-anak-an so kataotao a civet,
S.TRANSL: 他們一去，哇塞！一隻大的 堵在洞口，civet蟹之大，猶如嬰孩的身體般大
When they went to look, oh, it was an enormous civet, as big as an infant, blocking the hole.

S.FORM: cita-en da o ka-ka-kamay na am, ta, ji a-ka-kmi pi-pi-pili a, aráko a,
S.TRANSL: 他們再看螃蟹的腳，哇塞！像織布機的pipili棒一樣大，超大的
They looked at its legs, and oh, they were huge, so big that they looked like pipipili sticks that are used for weaving.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, ma-níring o mavakes, ta ma-haha o mavakes a ma-tetehnan ori am,
S.TRANSL: 太太說， 。因為那女的比較貪吃，饞嘴
The wife said. The wife was gluttonous.

S.FORM: “ana, m-amen koa! imo rana am, rakep-en mo an, ta ha-hap-en ta an” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: “喂，孩子的爸！你去捉它，我們把它捉來吃了好不好”
“Hey, ‘Dad’, go and catch it, and we will eat it.”

S.FORM: “a ji máng-avay si alikey” koan na, “wo! a ji nimsim-i o tageh na ito, yew, ya akmi savilak”,
S.TRANSL: 先生說“孩子會罵人？” “喔！你看它的腳，喲！像舵一樣大，真想啃呢
“Our child will be angry!” the husband said. “Oh! Look at those claws. Wow, they’re as big as rudders. I really want to have a bite.”

S.FORM: “tang a”, ma-tetehnan o mavakes ori, “key! rakep-en ta rana” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: “啊喲， ”，那女的真饞嘴，“快呀，我們把它捉起來嘛” 女的說
“Ahh ”The woman was very gluttonous. “Quick, catch it quickly!” the woman said.

S.FORM: “wo, ya ko ji a-rawa”, “a to ta ngap-a, ta ji máng-avay si koa”, “ciata, ya na ji a-cita”,
S.TRANSL: “哇塞，我捉不動它呢” ，“我們怎麼可以捉了它？孩子會罵人的” ，“沒關係啦，他又沒看到”
“Wow, I can’t even hold it!” “How can we do this? Our child will be angry!” “It’s okay, he can’t see it.”

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, “nohon”, to da minan-i, am to da á-rawa,
S.TRANSL: “好吧” ，於是他們合力去捉它，但哪裡捉得動啊。
“All right,” and the two of them tried to catch the crab together, but they could not hold it.

S.FORM: ji sia na ni-ma-koan sang a, to sia rana máng-ap so rako a vato a i-bhes da jia,
S.TRANSL: 結果他們不捉了，乾脆找了一塊大石頭把螃蟹給砸了
Because they could not catch it, they decided to just kill the crab with a rock.

S.FORM: ratateng am, ma-zakat ori, ta ji a-zakat, ratateng am, ha-hap-en da am, ji da a-nat ori a,
S.TRANSL: 螃蟹就死了。當然啦，用石頭砸它，它怎麼可能不死？後來，他們就把它抬回去，可是太重了，他們抬不動
The crab died. With a rock, how could the crab not die? After the crab died, they wanted to take it home, but it was too heavy to carry.

S.FORM: ta maka-ngay ori do panontonan da, a ji a-ráko a, miratateng am, i-oli da,
S.TRANSL: 連大網袋也裝不下，那螃蟹真的很大，但最後還是帶回家去了
Their mesh bag wasn’t big enough to fit it in, for the crab was very big, but they finally got it home.

S.FORM: “bezbez-an ta, mo ka-bagbag, ta si to na apis-i yaten ni alikey am, a ji abo ka-ji na zakat-an jiaten a”,
S.TRANSL: “喂，動作快呀，不然被孩子趕上了，他一定會殺了我們”
“Shit, move, or the child will catch up with us, and he will kill us!”

S.FORM: ka-bezbez da jia dengdeng-en a, “mi ka pa sio do ranom a”, “mi ka pa sio do attaw” koan da,
S.TRANSL: 於是他們急急忙忙的煮螃蟹。“你去取一下水！” “你也去取一下海水！” 他們說
They hurried and tried to cook the crab. “Go get the water.” “Go get the sea water.” They said.

S.FORM: akmi ma-sáray sira ori, ta y-akan da ori ori a,
S.TRANSL: 想到要吃大螃蟹，就是忙也忙得很愉快
But thinking of eating such a large crab, they were very excited.

S.FORM: ratateng am, y-angay na o attaw a, “mi-bezbez ka” koan na, ta ma-sngen o ranom,
S.TRANSL: 後來先生去取海水時，太太仍不忘記叮嚀“要快點哦” 。可是打水的地方又不近（快也要等的）
When the husband went to get water, the wife kept rushing him, saying, “Quick!” The closest place to get water, though, was not that close [you still have to wait.

S.FORM: “mi-bezbez ka sio, m-amen koa, ta to na apis-i yaten” koan na, ratateng am, malayo ori a ma-ngay do ranom, ka-dengdeng da rana sia.
S.TRANSL: “孩子的爹，你動作要快點，不然孩子會趕上我們” 太太說。於是就用跑的去取水，然後趕緊煮螃蟹
“‘Dad’, move your lazy butt, or the child will come back,” the wife said. He ran to get water, and ran to get back to cook the crab.

S.FORM: pangay-in da do kama da am, a oyad a kama, ta kena ni-paka-pia da tana ikong, do vanga am,
S.TRANSL: 他們把螃蟹放進鍋子裡；可是他們的鍋子也不是真正的鍋子，而是陶土做的土鍋啦，那算什麼嘛
They put the crab in the pot. The pots they used before weren’t like the ones we use now. They used a clay pot. It’s not much of a pot.

S.FORM: mi da pa-kas-en am, to na neheb-a, to-da a-teheb o vanga, ta ji a-rehmet,
S.TRANSL: 他們把螃蟹一放進鍋裡，鍋底隨即破了洞，因為螃蟹太重了
When the crab was put in, the bottom immediately broke open. It was just too heavy.

S.FORM: ratateng am, “ji ta na dengdeng-a, mo ka-bagbag, a ikong o rotong-an ta jia”,
S.TRANSL: “啊喲，怎麼辦？難道就這樣不煮了嗎？用什麼鍋子煮才好呢？”
“what should we do? Should we not cook it? What pot should we use?”

S.FORM: “a ya ji ngian pa so asa ka vanga ta”, ’akas-en da am, i-kélal da akas-en, ta i-hawa da ma-teheb a,
S.TRANSL: “我們還有一個鍋子” 。於是他們很小心的取下鍋子，深怕鍋子又破了
“We still have one pot.” They carefully took the pot down, afraid it would break,

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, i-kélal da am, apía rana, a ka-dengdeng da sia.
S.TRANSL: 他們小心翼翼的把螃蟹放進鍋裡後，終於成功的下鍋，然後就煮了
and placed the crab in slowly and gently. When they were finally ready, they started to cook it.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, to mi-pako-pakoad o kama-kamay na ai-ai na am,
S.TRANSL: 螃蟹的腳在鍋裡掙扎
The crab’s legs were still moving.

S.FORM: to na pa-tango-a o asa ka tageh na am, o ngazab no vanga da am, to-da a-skil am,
S.TRANSL: 忽然，螃蟹把腳一抬，鍋子的口緣又破了一塊
Suddenly, the crab pulled its claw up, and the opening of the pot broke.

S.FORM: “apia ori, apia o akma sang” koan da, i-ké-yngen da am, mi-ratateng am, to rana a-wákwak rana ni-ma-koat rana.
S.TRANSL: “啊呀，怎麼辦啊，怎麼辦啊？” 他們很傷腦筋的說。但不久後螃蟹也被熱水燙死了
“Ah, what should we do? what should we do?” they said. It was a headache. After a while, the crab was boiled to death.

S.FORM: ma-dengdeng rana am, mang-hap rana sira so vato-vato a i-tangtang da sia, ta to da á-nget,
S.TRANSL: 煮熟了以後，他們就拿石頭來打碎蟹殼，因為他們咬不動
After it was done, they grabbed rocks to open the shell, for it was too hard to open with their teeth.

S.FORM: ratateng am, “mi-bezbez ta sio a k-om-an sia”, tang, mi-bezbez sira am, a to da bezbez-i,
S.TRANSL: “我們吃快一點” 。呵！他們說要快點吃就能很快的吃完啊？那是不可能的！
“Let’s eat quickly!” Oh! Eating so much was not that easy.

S.FORM: sim-simsim-an da rana ori a miaven-do-vahay a,
S.TRANSL: 他們夫妻倆拼命的啃吃螃蟹
The husband and wife ate off the bones as fast as they could.

S.FORM: “oya o ya na moa-moa ni alikey a viniay na ori” koan na no mavakes na,
S.TRANSL: “這就是孩子在養的那隻螃蟹啊” 那女的說
“So our son raised such a large crab!” the wife said.

S.FORM: “ji ka maka-ziak, mo ka-bagbag a, yaten rana am, ka-bezbez ta do ka-pi-simsim ta, ta ci to na ngaong-a yaten am, to na zakat-a yaten”.
S.TRANSL: “你想死啊，別囉嗦了，趕快吃，不然被孩子趕上了，會被他殺掉”
“You want to die? Quick! Don’t talk. If the child comes, he will kill us!”

S.FORM: teyka da na ori a kan-en a ráko a kotat am, “imo rana am, samsam-an mo o ni-ni-akan-an ta an, o ya mi-cia-zim-zimzim ori am, mimín-en mo a avias-an”,
S.TRANSL: 他們吃完了大螃蟹以後，先生說“你趕快把吃過的地方掃乾淨，蟹殼碎屑都要清理得乾乾淨淨”
When they finally polished off all the crab, the husband said, “Quickly clean up where we ate, and all the bits and pieces must be completely swept up.”

S.FORM: “nohon”, ka-vias na rana jia do ni-ni-akan-an da sia do sdep-an am, k-abo na rana no vaza-vazay da, ta ni-vi-vias-an da rana.
S.TRANSL: “好的！” 太太就把吃螃蟹的前廊都清理得乾乾淨淨。清理完了就沒事了
“Yes!” the wife cleaned up all the areas on the front hallway where there were pieces of crab shell. After she finished cleaning, they had nothing to worry about.

S.FORM: to rana ngoli o anak na ang, m-oli rana o anak na am, ka-teng-an na ori,
S.TRANSL: 不久他們的孩子回家了。但他還不知道發生了什麼事
After a while, their child came home. He didn’t know what had happened.

S.FORM: mang-ap rana so adoa vekeh do ma-vaw na rana ori, m-osok rana,
S.TRANSL: 他一如往常一樣的拿了兩個冷飯（芋頭）下去海邊
He took two taros down to the sea as he always did.

S.FORM: “apia ori a, apia ori” koan da, “a ya na ka-teng-an ni ikoa” koan na no mehakay a,
S.TRANSL: “啊呀，怎麼辦啊，怎麼辦啊？” 他們兩夫妻說。“他不會知道的” 先生說
“Ah, what should we do? What should we do?” the couple said. “He won’t know,” the husband said.

S.FORM: maka-ranes rana am, “a ya ji ngian do sahad na ori a”,
S.TRANSL: 他到了海邊以後，他想“它一定在洞裡的”
When the child got to the sea, he thought, “It should be in the hole.”

S.FORM: ma-níring am, “pi-cingi-cingi rana kota-kotat, ta oya rana so kanen mo a so-soli” koan na, am to na mak-owbóc-i no ráko a cinodotodo ori,
S.TRANSL: 他叫“kotakotat你快出來吧，我帶了芋頭給你吃” ，可是cinodotodo怎麼（說錯蟹名）會出來
“Kotakotat, come out, for I have some taro for you,” the child said, but he didn’t see cinodotodo [said wrong crab’s name come out.

S.FORM: “pi-cingi-cingi rana kota-kotat, ta oya rana so kanen mo a so-soli” koan na, a ikong, ta to na ngian-i no mi-cicicit,
S.TRANSL: 他又叫“kotakotat出來吧，我帶了芋頭給你吃” 。可是哪有？根本就沒有會吱吱叫的螃蟹爬出來
“Kotakotat, come out, for I have some food for you,” he called again. Of course there wasn’t any crab there, so how could it come out chattering?

S.FORM: ta no mak-owbot ori am, “ci ci ci ”koan na no ikoa ang, i-zi-ziak na no moa-moa na ikoa ori a.
S.TRANSL: 螃蟹出洞的時候，都會吱吱吱的叫。這是他的小寵物叫時發出的聲音
Every time the crab came out, it would chatter. This is the sound it made when he called it.

S.FORM: ratateng am, “pi-cingi-cingi rana kota-kotat, ”koan na,
S.TRANSL: “kotakotat出來吧， ”他不斷的叫
“Kotakotat, come on out ”He kept on yelling.

S.FORM: a ma-níring ori am, “ya abo o saon”, to na rana vozovóza o ikoa am, ta ikong to ngian,
S.TRANSL: 他想“它真的不見了？” 於是[拿了木棍 就往洞裡攪動一下，但什麼也沒有
“Has it really disappeared?” the child thought. He took a [wooden stick and poked into the hole, but there was nothing there.

S.FORM: to rana ngóli ori am, tang a ji lavi a, “ikong a, ya mo i-ka-meneng, manga anak ko” koan da,
S.TRANSL: 他哭著回家去。“怎麼了，孩子，你傷心什麼？” 他們說
He ran home crying. “My dear child, what are you crying about?”

S.FORM: om-lavi rana ori, “ay, a si Ama si Ama si Ama” koan na, to na pa-ikoa-n o mata na do palawan tapi am,
S.TRANSL: 他哭喊著說“啊！天啊！我的天啊！” 。忽然，他的視線無意的往地板縫隙看了去
“Oh! Oh my god, oh my god!” the child cried. Suddenly he saw something underneath the floor boards totally by accident.

S.FORM: sínodo ji ní-m-akas do palawan tapi o ni-simsim-an da ori a, “a ikong ori”,
S.TRANSL: 他們啃過的碎屑沒有掉進縫裡，他想“那是什麼？”
Some of the pieces had not fallen into the hole, and he thought, “What is that?”

S.FORM: to na valiked-a o palawan tapi am, “ji a-tayo saon a ikoa am”,
S.TRANSL: 他把木板掀開來，說“這是那個，瞞不了人的”
When he flipped up the board to check it out, he thought, “This is (a crab’s shell). They couldn’t hide it.”

S.FORM: “ya nio mi ni-a-hap o ya ko ni-azo-azovo a ikoa a i civet ang” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 他說“你們是否捉了我養的civet蟹？”
“Did you catch my crab that I raised as a pet?” he asked.

S.FORM: “mi namen hap-an sia, mo keypong” koan da, “a tana ji nio nayo-a am, beken ito”,
S.TRANSL: 他們說“親愛的孩子，我們怎麼會去捉它呢？” “你們不要再隱瞞了，你們看那是什麼？”
“My dear, how could we have taken that?” they replied. “You can’t hide it from me. What is this?”

S.FORM: to mi-vali-valíked am, tang! aro a ni-ni-aka-kan-an da,
S.TRANSL: 他將木板一個個掀起來，喝！全是他們吃過的蟹殼碎屑
He flipped up the floor boards one by one, and lo and behold, there was the crab shell from the eaten crab.

S.FORM: “si Ama si Ama si Ama”, to lavi rana ori, i-ka-’oya na rana sira ina na.
S.TRANSL: 他哭著不斷的喊“天啊，我的天啊！” 他開始氣恨他的父母
“Oh my god, oh my god, OH MY GOD!” he cried out. He was furious at his parents.

S.FORM: ikay-an na si ina na ka ni ama na am, to rana angay do ke-ysak-an a,
S.TRANSL: 他不滿他的父母吃了他的寵物，就跑去海邊的礁石群處
He was very hopping mad because his parents ate his pet. And then he ran to the coral reefs beside the sea.

S.FORM: rako a vato a beken a kakawan a, to rana mi-zí-ziak a, o vato ori am ni-siri-siring na o vato,
S.TRANSL: 有一塊大石頭，不是礁石。他對大石頭說話
There was a big rock not part of the coral reef. He told the big rock,

S.FORM: ratateng am, to mi-váwa o rako a vato a, ka-to na rana agcín-an do mi-vawa rako a vato a mi-kizi ori a,
S.TRANSL: 後來大石頭真的裂開了，他就進入了已裂開的大石頭裡面
The rock opened, and he fell inside.

S.FORM: akmi ovo-ovok na o ma-cita am, “pi-komi rana yaken, pi-tapi rana yaken” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: 好像只露出了一點頭髮在石頭外面時，“快把我夾住吧，夾住我吧” 他說
Only his hair showed. “Squish me, squish me,” he told the rock.

S.FORM: o mao ori am, to na rana pi-tapí-a o k-anak-an ang, ovo-ovok na rana, am ni-ma-cita da ori a ni-m-osok do ni-angay-an na ori a.
S.TRANSL: 那石頭把小孩夾起來了，只有一點頭髮露在石頭上了。被下去海邊的人看見他進入石頭裡的經過
The rock squished the child, and only the hair showed. Some people who had gone down there saw him go into the rock.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, ka-to na a-kmán-an so sang a, to-da a-kóyab rana am, to-da a-séyrem am,
S.TRANSL: 就這樣。直到傍晚過了，晚上也來臨了的時候
Like this, evening passed and night came.

S.FORM: “a ya pa ji ngoli si ikoa ang” koan da, mi da kala-en am, to da a-kala,
S.TRANSL: 他們（父母）說“孩子怎麼到現在還不回來？” 然後他們就去找他，可是哪裡找得到？
“Why hasn’t our child come back?” the parents said. They went to look, but how was it possible to find him?

S.FORM: “cipenzak am, ji rana ngai” koan da,
S.TRANSL: 他們想，“明天早上總會回來吧”
“Maybe he will come home tomorrow morning” they said.

S.FORM: am pe-pnezak do mi da cita-n sia am, a ji da ni-soo no ni-mam-onot so apoy am, to da a-kala,
S.TRANSL: 其實，早上他們找他的前一晚上，曾有人拿火把去照（找）過他，只是沒找到他而已
Actually someone had gone to look the night before with a torch, but they never found him. In the morning they continued their search.

S.FORM: apnezak am, “ya ji ni-mi-ta-tanek do jia si ikoa ang” koan da am,
S.TRANSL: 早上的時候，他們說，“他曾經站過這裡呢？”
In the morning, they said, “Didn’t the child stand here before?”

S.FORM: mi da cita-en do mao am, am-ian o ovok na do tey-ngato na no mao ang,
S.TRANSL: 他們去大石頭那裡時，發現他頭髮還露在石頭上
They went to look at the big rock, and they found his hair on the surface.

S.FORM: am ni-pi-tapi no rako a mao ang, ori o ni-ikay-an na do ina na ka no ama na,
S.TRANSL: 但已被大石頭夾住了。這是因為不滿父母親（吃了他的小寵物）的故事
The body was already squished by the rock. This was because he was furious that his parents ate his pet crab.

S.FORM: ta to da i nga-hap-a o moa-moa na rako a civet ori a,
S.TRANSL: 因為他的父母拿（吃掉）了他的寵物──就是大civet蟹
This was because his parents took (ate) his pet - the big civet crab.

S.FORM: o m-ian jia am, “ta no ci ha-hap-en ko am, ka-veyvow-an ko a kan-en, a ji tamo mi-taza-tazangoso-i a, ji tamo a lovoc-i a kan-en,
S.TRANSL: 他的想法是，“我若要吃了它，我也不會獨吞，我一定會請大家一起來享用它的”
He thought, “If I were to kill it, I wouldn’t eat it alone, but I would share with all my family”.

S.FORM: “a nio to-dey ngap-i so sang, a akma ko i viniay” koan na no k-anak-an am, ori ni-ikay-an na da ama na am da ina na.
S.TRANSL: “可是你們怎麼可以捉了它，它就像是我養的家畜一樣” ，小孩子心裡這樣想，因此他才會那麼不滿他的父母親
“But why did you catch it and eat it?” The child thought of it this way, and he was fuming about what his parents did.

S.FORM: “nona, amizing-en nio a, to kamo mi-wálam a,
S.TRANSL: “好吧，那麼你們聽故事的時候，要乖乖的不要亂動哦
“Sure, if you want to listen, just sit down quietly.

S.FORM: “a ikong ori” koan na am, “taon, a ya ka-teng-an”.
S.TRANSL: “那個究竟是什麼呢？” ，“不曉得啊！誰知道”
“What is that?” “Don’t know! Who knows?”

S.FORM: ji ngimo-ngímong, ta no ma-ngay ori am, abo do vahay na ori am,
S.TRANSL: 他從不間斷地去看它。每次看它不在岩洞時
He never stopped (going). Every time he went to look, if he did not see the crab in the hole,

S.FORM: to na ipi-tlo am, “pi-cingi-cingi rana kota-kotat, ta i-panta ko imo so kan-en mo a ma-vaw” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 於是他第三次再叫，“kotakotat你出來吧，我給你帶了涼飯來”
He cried for a third time, “Kotakotat, come out, for I have some leftover for you.”

S.FORM: tang a, ji a-kmi vanga o vahay na ori a,
S.TRANSL: 呵，它住的洞穴像鍋子一樣大呢
Wow! His cave was as big as a pot.

S.FORM: to na minán-i o asa ka tageh na no mavakes ori a hap-en am, ta to na a-ráwa, to na netnét-a saon o mavakes am,
S.TRANSL: 那女的說著一面就去捉了螃蟹的腳，但她哪裡抓得動？反而還被螃蟹給拉了
As she spoke, she grabbed one of the claws, but how could she hold it? She was dragged away by the crab.

S.FORM: “imo am, to ka rana mi-kízi, ta ma-ngay ko do dang, ta pi-cimi-in mo yaken”, to-dey m-alio rana do rako a mao ang.
S.TRANSL: “石頭啊，請你裂開成兩半，我要進到你裡面，請你把我夾起來” ，說著就進入了那個大石頭的裡面
“Rock, please split in half, for I want to enter you. Please crush me.” After saying this, he entered.
